responsibilities: Develop LLM-powered solutions such as RAG architectures on proprietary knowledge repositories, querying unstructured data with natural language, and content generation.
Build, integrate, and scale LLM-based applications into business workflows across a variety of domains.
Collaborate with data engineering and ML teams to innovate and establish best practices for MDLC and LLM evaluation frameworks.
Collaborate with the product and client services teams to define priorities and influence the product roadmap.
Mentor junior AI/ML engineers, guiding them in building a modern AI infrastructure and developing responsible AI solutions.
skills: Experience with the latest techniques in natural language processing including vector databases, fine-tuning LLMs, RAG, and deploying LLMs with tools such as HuggingFace, Langchain, and OpenAI.
Extensive software engineering skills building enterprise platforms and handling large datasets.
Highly proficient in Python, Javascript, and other programming languages.
Proven leadership skills, a strategic mindset, and a passion for driving innovation in AI.
Experience or knowledge of working in a compliance-based environment, including building and deploying compliant software solutions throughout the software life cycle.
Exceptional stakeholder management and communication skills to effectively communicate across global teams.
analysis:
The job responsibilities explicitly mention the development of "LLM-powered solutions" and "LLM-based applications," which directly indicates involvement with Large Language Models. The responsibilities also include tasks such as querying unstructured data with natural language and content generation, which are typical applications of Generative AI and LLMs. Additionally, the role involves collaborating on LLM evaluation frameworks, further emphasizing the focus on language models.

The skills required for the job include experience with natural language processing techniques, fine-tuning LLMs, and deploying LLMs using tools like HuggingFace, Langchain, and OpenAI. These are all directly related to working with Generative AI and language models. The mention of vector databases and RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) also supports the involvement with LLMs.

Overall, both the responsibilities and skills clearly indicate that the job involves working with Generative AI and language models.
